confidentiality.notes: Data _ Customers who completed an application for DoCoMo USA Wireless on the DoCoMo USA online application website. __ Items of information: "Customer name", "Address", "Date of birth", "Email address", "Credit card-related information (Name on card, Card number, Card issuer, Expiry date)". __ Affected customers: 403  _ Customers who completed an application for DoCoMo USA Wireless in part in a store. __ Items of information: "Phone number", "Service usage plan", "Contract site", "Account number". (Other information including names has not been leaked.) __ Affected customers: 1,805  The staff and admin details include emails from wasabikikaku.com and docomo-usa.com and have encrypted passwords.

(Other information including names has not been leaked.) __ Affected customers: 1,805  The staff and admin details include emails from wasabikikaku.com and docomo-usa.com and have encrypted passwords.  Actor Anonymous hacktivist LulzSec motive ideological  containment 2 days
summary: After publishing customer information taken from NTT DoCoMo on Friday, members of LulzSec today announced that they had knocked NTT DoCoMo's U.S. Web site online (h/t Cyber War News).  "TANGODOWN - http://docomo-usa.com #lulzsec #antisec #StopCISPA We are lulzsec. The most wanted fleet. Bow to our feet," the hackers tweeted earlier today.  At this point, the site has been down for 18 hours.  As Cyber War News notes, NTT DoCoMo also published an announcement on its Web site over the weekend admitting that U.S. customers' personal information had been published on April 26, but noting that Japanese customers' information was not accessed.  The company says it will be contacting affected customers individually to offer assistance.
